config.question: What did Eisenhower do to keep his promise “to bring the Korean War to an early and honorable end”?

choices.content: He traveled to Moscow to meet Stalin to hammer out a compromise.
He incited Japan to attack and force the Chinese to fight a war on two fronts.
He pumped in more soldiers, arms, and armament to squash the Chinese.
He spent three days in Korea assessing the terrain.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Eisenhower even hinted to China that he might use nuclear weapons to break the stalemated peace talks. He ruled out the new offensive the military favored: “Small attacks on small hills would not end the war.” See L.O. 28.4 The Cold War at Home.
